docs.lead_paragraph: Influential short-selling firm Citron Research did not publish new allegations against Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc on Monday as many investors had anticipated, giving the beleaguered shares of the Canadian drugmaker a boost.

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

docs.lead_paragraph: Forced individual arbitration often bears little resemblance to court: The rules tend to favor businesses, and judges and juries are replaced by arbitrators whose rulings are difficult to appeal.

headline.main: In Arbitration, a ‘Privatization of the Justice System’
headline.kicker: Beware the Fine Print | Part II
headline.content_kicker: Beware the Fine Print | Part II

docs.abstract: New York Times investigation finds thousands of businesses in last ten years have pushed for and use private arbitration, which greatly favors businesses over their clients and acts essentially as alternate system of justice; companies have been adding arbitration clauses to employment or consumer contracts that are rarely ever read; use of arbitration became even more desirable for companies following 2011 Supreme Court decision that allowed them to use such clauses to prevent class-action lawsuits (Series: Beware the Fine Print).
docs.snippet: Forced individual arbitration often bears little resemblance to court: The rules tend to favor businesses, and judges and juries are replaced by arbitrators whose rulings are difficult to appeal.

docs.lead_paragraph: In too many industries, the competition among companies that makes markets work best just doesn’t exist anymore.
docs.abstract: Editorial highlights research showing mergers and acquisitions in number of industries have hurt consumers by thinning out competition and have played role in increasing income inequality; calls on Justice Dept to challenge more mergers and acquisitions and on Congress to look into ways to strengthen antitrust laws.
docs.snippet: In too many industries, the competition among companies that makes markets work best just doesn’t exist anymore.
